description: Air Canada is reducing a number of non-union management positions, the airline said Thursday.
title: Air Canada makes 'difficult decision' to cut management jobs

description: A woman has been charged after being found with the man who earlier this week prompted an Amber Alert after allegedly killing another woman in Brampton, Ont., and fleeing with his one-year-old daughter.
title: Woman charged after being found with Amber Alert, homicide suspect in Niagara Falls this week

description: The youth was initially arrested in May, with investigators saying they believed the 15-year-old would commit terrorism offences related to the 764 online network, which targets vulnerable children by prowling gaming sites like Minecraft and Roblox and lures victims into private online chats.
title: Alberta teen faces new charges after terrorism peace bond for alleged online extremism ties
X-ray glasses? All the 'mind-boggling' allegations in the FBI's NBA gambling probe

description: The viral term is sweeping through classrooms and derailing lessons. But what does it even mean?
title: Why are kids yelling ‘6-7’ in class?

description: Members of B.C.’s Legislative Assembly have overwhelmingly voted down a proposed act from MLA Dallas Brodie that would prohibit publicly funded employees in schools and other public bodies from making land acknowledgements.
title: B.C. MLA's act to prohibit land acknowledgements in schools fails 1st reading

description: In an email sent to shoppers Thursday morning, the company said the breached records may include the names, addresses, emails and phone number
title: Toys 'R' Us Canada notifies customers of breach that may have compromised personal data

description: A senior Canadian government official told reporters Thursday that it's hoped Prime Minister Mark Carney will meet Chinese President Xi Jinping on the sidelines of a summit in South Korea next week.
title: Ottawa hoping for a Carney-Xi meeting in Asia next week, says official

description: A few days after Amazon's cloud services company AWS had an outage that plunged millions of popular websites and apps into the dark, questions still linger about why some companies get so big in the first place — and why it's so hard to keep them from controlling markets.
title: Amazon cloud outage downed millions of sites — and exposed the risks of overdependence

description: An Anne Shirley doll spotted in a Sydney, N.S., thrift store is earning jokes and nicknames online, but a Nova Scotia man says she’s still beautiful. In fact, she is one of the last surviving pieces of art by his late mother, and he wants to find her.
title: Thrift store doll dubbed 'Anne of Scream Gables' actually sculpture by late artist, says son

description: For Windsor, Ont., filmmaker Drew Hyttenrauch, it was the chance to do the production of a lifetime and highlight the issue of a growing need in the Down syndrome community — and one he and his sister are facing together.
title: Canadian filmmaker and his actor sister behind national ad about aging with Down Syndrome

description: Education Minister Paul Calandra says if an Ontario school board doesn't restore prom plans for three of its high schools that cancelled them, he will step in and do it.
title: Thinking about cancelling prom? Ontario education minister says 'think again'

description: President Donald Trump has pardoned Binance founder Changpeng Zhao, who created the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange and served prison time after failing to stop criminals from using the platform to move money connected to child sex abuse, drug trafficking and terrorism.
title: Trump pardons Canadian Binance CEO who failed to stop illegal activity on crypto platform

description: Details of another settlement between the Government of Alberta and a coal company have been released. This time, the province has agreed to pay $95 million to Evolve Power.
title: Alberta to pay $95M settlement to another coal company over policy change

description: The federal Liberal government announced Thursday changes to the justice system that are intended to keep some offenders locked up for longer as Ottawa tries and drive down crime rates.
title: Carney government gets tougher on crime with proposed bail regime changes

description: The White House is tearing down part of the East Wing this week to make room for U.S. President Donald Trump's ballroom, but it's not the only renovation that has occurred since he took office in January.
title: IN PHOTOS | A look at Trump's White House renos

description: Premier Doug Ford and Prime Minister Mark Carney are announcing the new spending at a news conference being carried live by CBC News Thursday morning. Construction on the first of four small modular reactors already started earlier this year.
title: Feds, province to spend $3B on mini nuclear power plant in Bowmanville, Ont.

description: Alberta’s government will “end the landlocking” of the oilsands by working with partners to build pipelines to B.C.’s northwest coast and Ontario, Lt.-Gov. Salma Lakhani says in the speech from the throne.
title: Alberta throne speech pledges new pipelines and a boost for artificial intelligence

description: The Alberta government has served formal notice that they will introduce back-to-work legislation to end the Alberta teachers’ strike.
title: Back-to-work legislation coming to end the Alberta teachers’ strike

description: As legislation looms ordering striking Alberta teachers back to work, Jennifer Black is bittersweet about returning to class to teach English to dozens of anxious Grade 12 students while feeling hopeless herself.
title: Legislation looms to end teachers' strike in Alberta as students face stress, uncertainty

description: Canadian research scientist Cori Lausen is studying probiotics as a treatment for white-nose syndrome, which is caused by a fungus called Pseudogymnoascus destructans.
title: As white-nose syndrome threatens bats nationwide, this scientist's probiotic ‘cocktail’ could save them

description: Miami Heat guard Terry Rozier and Portland Trail Blazers head coach Chauncey Billups have been arrested in connection with a federal investigation into sports betting, people familiar with the matter told The Associated Press and ESPN on Thursday.
title: Heat's Rozier, Trail Blazers' Billups arrested in federal gambling probe, reports say

description: The Canada Industrial Relations Board has dismissed an argument from the Canada Post workers union that a government back-to-work order was unconstitutional.
title: Canada Post workers union loses challenge of back-to-work order

description: A former British paratrooper who was the only soldier ever charged in the 1972 Bloody Sunday massacre in Northern Ireland was acquitted Thursday of murder charges.
title: British soldier acquitted on murder, attempted murder charges for 1972 Northern Ireland killings
King Charles becomes the first British royal to pray with pope in nearly 500 years

description: When wildfires began rapidly spreading across Manitoba in May — the start of a fire season that forced 32,000 out of their homes — the province was short dozens of fire rangers, and 25 per cent of its wildfire division positions were vacant, CBC has learned.
title: Dozens of firefighting positions unfilled when Manitoba wildfires began in May: documents

description: The European Union has agreed on a new raft of sanctions against Russia targeting its shadow fleet of oil tankers and banning its imports of liquefied natural gas, the Danish EU presidency announced Thursday.
title: EU joins U.S. in heaping more sanctions on Russia to push Putin into Ukraine peace talks

description: The European Union has agreed on a new raft of sanctions against Russia targeting its shadow fleet of oil tankers and banning its imports of liquefied natural gas, the Danish EU presidency announced Thursday.
title: EU joins U.S. in heaping more sanctions on Russia to push Putin into Ukraine peace talks

description: A Halifax man died in February after waiting 40 minutes for a paramedic to respond to a police request for medical assistance. The unions for 911 dispatchers and paramedics say low staffing often contributes to delays.
title: 'People calling and then the ambulance not coming happens a lot,' says N.S. 911 dispatchers' union
Did Via Rail get more expensive? Some commuters say they're being priced out

description: Concert tickets can be costly, especially for those on fixed incomes. That’s why Mike Boguski — keyboard player for the Canadian rock band Blue Rodeo — brought his talents to Grace Place in Thunder Bay, Ont., an organization that provides free meals, clothing and an Out of the Cold Program to people in need. Boguski says that as the band tours, he's looking to do free performances at other shelters, food banks and outreach centres.
title: Blue Rodeo keyboardist's free performances bring 'healing joy of music' to Ontario shelters and food banks

description: The trial for two Burlington women charged with murder heard from Ontario’s deputy chief forensic pathologist, who conducted an autopsy on the 12-year-old boy who died in 2022, as proceedings continued in Milton court.
title: Pathologist tells murder trial for 2 Ontario women that he couldn’t determine cause of 12-year-old’s death

description: The buildup of U.S. military forces near Venezuela and a series of deadly attacks on alleged drug-trafficking boats in waters off its coast has raised the spectre of an invasion of the South American country. Yet that still appears unlikely, some experts say, as any military action launched by the Trump administration would face significant resistance.
title: Trump's pressure on Venezuela raises spectre of coup or invasion. Either face major hurdles
